What I want to do is use a template order.xml and settings dir, with
our default configuration, settings, etc. as the basis for creating
new crawls (but not within a running heritrix instance) for
submittal/crawling at a later time (manually, or maybe in some kind of
workflow queue system).

In most cases, the only things that would change are the elements in
the meta block in order.xml (name, audience, etc).  At some point we'd
want to be able to add domain-specific settings (filters, etc), but
for now simply being able to set the name, etc. would be a good start.
 In other words I want to be able to call something like
createNewCrawl(templateName, newCrawlName, newCrawlAudience, newCrawlDir)

I haven't been able to figure out how to do it though.  The xsd is
pretty generic, not laying out the elements and attributes by
name/type.  I had hoped to use xbeans to create a wrapper around the
xsd, but with the the xsd provided it doesn't seem to allow me to do
what I need.  I tried looking at how the wui does it, but it's all
within the context of a running heritrix instance.

Am I missing something obvious, looking in the wrong place?  Any
ideas, pointers?

Thanks,
Rob Eger
Local Matters, Inc.
